Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different plants and animals, including humans, in their habitats.
The student can label the habitats where various plants and animals live.
The student can illustrate and label the materials that animals and plants need to survive, like water, food, and sunlight.
The student can show how different plants and animals are connected to the resources in their habitats (e.g., fish swimming in water).
The student can demonstrate the relationships between the living things and their environment, such as which animals live in which habitats and why.
The student can connect each plant or animal to the specific resources they rely on in their environment.
The student can represent the system of how habitats work together to support living things, showing that each part has a role.
